definition: How do you catch the tiger cub without entering the tiger's lair? (idiom); Nothing ventured, nothing gained.
pinyin: bu4 ru4 hu3 xue2 , yan1 de2 hu3 zi3

definition: (negative prefix)/not/no
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

where/how
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
Only an outstanding talent can recognize current trends (idiom). A wise man submits to circumstances.
pinyin: shi2 shi2 wu4 zhe3 wei4 jun4 jie2

definition: lit. to dispatch a general is not as effective as to excite a general/fig. inciting people to action is more effective than dispatching orders
pinyin: qing3 jiang4 bu4 ru2 ji1 jiang4

definition: no poison, no great man (idiom); A great man has to be ruthless.
one who does not fear the death of thousand cuts will dare to unhorse the emperor (proverb)/to a fearless person, no fence is high enough
pinyin: she3 de5 yi1 shen1 gua3 , gan3 ba3 huang2 di4 la1 xia4 ma3
related.word: 舍得一身剐，敢把皇帝拉下马

definition: He who comes is surely ill-intentioned, no-one well-meaning will come (idiom)./Be careful not to trust foreigners./Beware of Greeks bearing gifts!
pinyin: lai2 zhe3 bu4 shan4 , shan4 zhe3 bu4 lai2

definition: there can never be too much deception in war/in war nothing is too deceitful/all's fair in war
While the green hills last, there'll be wood to burn (idiom). Where there's life there's hope.
pinyin: liu2 de5 qing1 shan1 zai4 , bu4 pa4 mei2 chai2 shao1
related.word: 留得青山在，不怕没柴烧

definition: place sb on a field of death and he will fight to live (idiom based on Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3]); to fight desperately when confronting mortal danger/fig. to find a way out of an impasse
pinyin: zhi4 zhi1 si3 di4 er2 hou4 sheng1

definition: to defeat the enemy by capturing their chief (idiom)

Since they have come, we should make them comfortable (idiom). Since we're here, take it easy./Since this is so, we should accept it./Now we have come, let's stay and take the rough with the smooth./If you can't do anything to prevent it, you might as well sit back and enjoy it.
pinyin: ji4 lai2 zhi1 , ze2 an1 zhi1

definition: lit. a wise person reflecting a thousand times can still make a mistake (idiom); fig. nobody is infallible
pinyin: zhi4 zhe3 qian1 lu:4 , bi4 you3 yi1 shi1

definition: lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
counter soldiers with arms, water with an earth weir (idiom); different situations call for different action/to adopt measures appropriate to the actual situation
pinyin: bing1 lai2 jiang4 dang3 , shui3 lai2 tu3 yan3

definition: see 三十六計，走為上策|三十六计，走为上策[san1 shi2 liu4 ji4 , zou3 wei2 shang4 ce4]
pinyin: san1 shi2 liu4 ji4 , zou3 wei2 shang4 ji4

definition: lit. human beings will die for riches, just as birds will for food (idiom)/fig. man will do anything in his means to become rich
pinyin: ren2 wei4 cai2 si3 , niao3 wei4 shi2 wang2

definition: lit. to break the cauldrons and sink the boats (idiom); fig. to cut off one's means of retreat/to burn one's boats
